alert.note: Alert for Custer; Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 30 at 6:40PM MDT until August 30 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Custer County in southeastern Montana... Northern Powder River County in southeastern Montana... * Until 730 PM MDT. * At 639 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 19 miles west of Terry to 16 miles west of Volborg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar and weather station indicated. At 615 PM, 70 mph winds were reported 20 miles north of Forsyth. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Miles City, Volborg, Twelve Mile Dam, Locate, Powderville, Garland, Moon Creek Ranch, Strawberry Hill Recreation Area, Matthews Recreation Area, Mizpah, and Knowlton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
